parameters:
I was surprised to find a koban coin placed at the entrance.
I'm not sure if it was left by the Phantom Thief Nezumi
Komachi, but I'll gratefully use it for teaching materials.

...Is that so, that's great. (Dad has been donating money to
the temple school, so I left some too. I'm glad they're
happy with it♪)

It's time for calligraphy now. I'm being taught how to write
by the teacher.

I'm not good at writing... Karin-oneechan is also good at
drawing, isn't she? I admire that.

Hey, you can't fall asleep... Sensei will get mad at us...
(whispering)

I ate all the dango at home. Grandpa also seemed to enjoy
eating them♪

Ah, Karin-neechan! Did you come all the way to the temple
hut to play? I'm so happy♪

Oei-san asked me to bring some dango as a treat. You're
studying properly, that's great.

Ehehe, it's calligraphy time right now. Neechan, can you
write the kanji for 'mouse'?

Uh--!? Mouse in... kanji...? (I call myself 'Nezumi
Komachi', but I can't write it!)
It's like this. This is the kanji for 'mouse'?
...Amazing. You know more kanji than I do, Omitsu-chan.

Ehehe! Grandpa was chasing a mouse, so I looked it up and
learned how to write the kanji～

...Hmm, I see. That must have been tough. So a mouse
appeared at your home?

Hey hey, class is still in session, you know? If you have
business, Karin-san, please wait until after class is over.

Ah! Uh, sorry! Well then, Omitsu-chan. Eat the dango soon,
okay!
Yeah! Thank you! Say hi to Oei-san for me～
--Karin left the temple hut and went home.
After studying a lot, it became evening before I knew it.

I came to pick you up because it's late. Did something
happen?

Sorry. After the temple hut class ended, the teacher taught
me a lot of characters!

I see. That's good. It's about time for dinner. Let's go
home quickly.

Karin-oneechan, will you also practice calligraphy? Sensei
is really good at teaching, so you'll improve quickly♪
I'm so hungry... Is it lunchtime yet...
